news-item.title: Coalgate: ED set to speed up money laundering probe
news-item.text: New Delhi, March 16 -- After the CBI's coal scam charge sheet against P Trivikrama Prasad and Y Harish Chandra Prasad, former promoters of Navabharat Power Private Limited, the enforcement directorate (ED) is set to speed up its money laundering probe in the case. "Two coal blocks were allocated to Navabharat Power in 2008 by the government along with five other companies. Two years later, the promoters sold the company for ' 231 crore to Essar but the book value of company was only ' 22 crore. The promoters allegedly managed to make an illegal gain of ' 208 crore on the basis of coal blocks allocated to them," said a CBI official requesting anonymity. "The illegal gain of ' 208 crore for the former promoters of Navabharat will treated as proceeds of crime by the ED and investigators will identify all the assets procured by this money to attach them," said an ED official on condition of anonymity. The Supreme Court has instructed the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to share all its probe documents in the coal scam with the ED. A CBI official confirmed that their chargesheet will soon be shared with the ED. The CBI, on March 10, had filed a 9500-page charge sheet ag ainst Navabharat Power Private Limited and its promoter-directors P Trivikrama Prasad and Y Harish Chandra Prasad.
